form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Coons (for himself, Mr. Tillis, Mr. Wyden, Ms. Lummis, Mr. Van Hollen, and Mr. Rounds) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

form.official-title: To amend the Fair Credit Reporting Act to prohibit consumer reporting agencies from furnishing consumer reports containing adverse items of information about a consumer that resulted from that consumer being unlawfully or wrongfully detained abroad or held hostage abroad.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fair Credit for American Hostages Act of 2025.

section.header: Adverse information about consumers unlawfully or wrongfully detained abroad or held hostage abroad

subsection.text: The Fair Credit Reporting Act (15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq.) is amended by inserting after section 605C the following:

section.header: Adverse information about consumers unlawfully or wrongfully detained abroad or held hostage abroad

paragraph.text: The term covered consumer means an individual who has been—

subparagraph.text: a United States national unlawfully or wrongfully detained abroad, as determined under section 302(a) of the Robert Levinson Hostage Recovery and Hostage-Taking Accountability Act (22 U.S.C. 1741(a)); or
a United States national taken hostage abroad, as determined by the Hostage Recovery Fusion Cell established by section 304 that Act (22 U.S.C. 1741b).

paragraph.text: The term detention or hostage documentation means documentation that—

subparagraph.text: certifies a consumer is a covered consumer under this section;
identifies the time period during which the covered consumer was unlawfully or wrongfully detained abroad or held hostage abroad; and

clause.text: the Special Presidential Envoy for Hostage Affairs established by section 303 of the Robert Levinson Hostage Recovery and Hostage-Taking Accountability Act (22 U.S.C. 1741a); or
the Hostage Recovery Fusion Cell established by section 304 of that Act (22 U.S.C. 1741b).

subsection.text: If a consumer reporting agency described in section 603(p) is able to authenticate detention or hostage documentation provided by a covered consumer, the consumer reporting agency may not furnish a consumer report containing any adverse item of information about the covered consumer dating during the time period the covered consumer was unlawfully or wrongfully detained abroad or held hostage abroad.
The table of contents of the Fair Credit Reporting Act is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 605C the following:

toc.toc-entry: 605D. Adverse information about consumers unlawfully or wrongfully detained abroad or held hostage abroad.
